tasks.name: Setup Backend Project Structure & Configuration
tasks.description: Create the foundational Python backend structure with proper configuration management, logging setup, and dependency management. Establish the core project architecture following documented standards.
tasks.notes: Foundation task for Track 1 - must be completed before any other backend tasks. Establishes coding standards and architectural patterns.

relatedFiles.description: Application entry point with proper logging and configuration loading
Centralized configuration constants for time scaling, physics, and thresholds
Shared utility functions and helper methods

tasks.implementationGuide: Create backend/ directory with main.py entry point, config.py for all constants (time scaling, physics parameters, thresholds), utils.py for shared utilities, and requirements.txt with dependencies: paho-mqtt, firebase-admin, scikit-learn, pandas, numpy. Setup Python logging configuration with appropriate log levels. Implement basic project structure validation and configuration loading mechanisms.
tasks.verificationCriteria: Backend directory structure created with all required files. Configuration constants properly defined matching documentation values. Requirements.txt includes all specified dependencies. Logging configured properly without print statements. Code follows type annotation standards.

tasks.name: Implement Physics Engine Core
tasks.description: Develop the core physics simulation engine that handles accelerated time scaling, temperature modeling, moisture dynamics, and day/night cycles according to specified mathematical models.
tasks.notes: Critical component containing all environmental simulation logic. Requires precise mathematical implementation matching documentation specifications.

relatedFiles.description: Core physics simulation with time scaling, temperature, moisture, and light models

tasks.implementationGuide: Implement physics_engine.py with TimeManager class for 1:6 time scaling, TemperatureModel using sinusoidal curve T=20+10*sin(time_offset), MoistureSystem with base evaporation (0.5%/tick), heat stress multiplier (2x >35°C), and sprinkler effects (+3%/tick). Include DayNightCycle class for 06:00-18:00 day periods. All calculations must use configuration constants and include proper error handling.
tasks.verificationCriteria: Physics engine correctly implements 1:6 time scaling ratio. Temperature follows sinusoidal curve with peak at 14:00. Moisture evaporation implements base rate and heat stress multiplier. Day/night cycle toggles correctly at 06:00 and 18:00. All calculations use config constants. Comprehensive type annotations and docstrings included.
tasks.analysisResult: Smart Green IoT Farm Simulation - Complete implementation of educational IoT system demonstrating accelerated time simulation, real-time MQTT telemetry, Firebase persistence, and predictive ML analytics through three parallel development tracks.

tasks.name: Develop ML Prediction System
tasks.description: Create the machine learning predictor using Linear Regression to forecast when soil moisture will reach critical threshold (30%), with rolling data buffer management and prediction formatting.
tasks.notes: Educational ML component demonstrating predictive analytics in IoT systems. Must handle edge cases gracefully and provide meaningful predictions.

relatedFiles.description: Linear regression model for moisture prediction with rolling buffer management

tasks.implementationGuide: Implement ml_predictor.py with MLPredictor class using scikit-learn LinearRegression. Maintain rolling buffer of (time_index, moisture_level) tuples. Retrain model every virtual hour (10 real seconds). Predict when moisture reaches 30% threshold and format as 'Xh Ym' string. Include error handling for insufficient data and edge cases. Buffer should reset at virtual day boundaries to prevent memory accumulation.
tasks.verificationCriteria: ML predictor successfully trains Linear Regression model on time-series data. Rolling buffer correctly manages data points and clears at day boundaries. Prediction accurately calculates time to 30% moisture threshold. Output formatted as readable time string. Error handling for insufficient data implemented. Model retraining occurs every virtual hour.

tasks.name: Build MQTT Communication Client
tasks.description: Implement MQTT publisher client that broadcasts telemetry data at 1Hz frequency to public broker with proper error handling and connection management.
tasks.notes: Real-time telemetry component critical for frontend visualization. Must maintain 1Hz publication rate and handle network failures gracefully.

relatedFiles.description: MQTT publisher with connection management and telemetry broadcasting
MQTT broker configuration and topic settings

tasks.implementationGuide: Create mqtt_client.py with MQTTPublisher class using paho-mqtt library. Connect to public broker (broker.hivemq.com or test.mosquitto.org) on topic cs335/bese13ab/sensor_data. Publish JSON payload every second with exact schema: moisture, temperature, light_intensity, hour, minute, time_str, day_progress, is_day, prediction, sprinkler_on. Implement connection retry logic, graceful disconnect handling, and logging for all connection events.
tasks.verificationCriteria: MQTT client successfully connects to public broker. Publishes telemetry data at exactly 1Hz frequency. JSON payload matches documented schema exactly. Connection retry logic works for network failures. Graceful shutdown and reconnection implemented. All network events properly logged.
